conclusion: Analyze forces acting on sphere A and use condition that tension in wire is zero.
Sphere A is on inclined plane, sphere B is to the right, both at same height, separated by distance d.
Identify forces on sphere A: gravitational force mg downward, electrostatic force Fe horizontally right, normal force N perpendicular to plane.
Resolve gravitational force into components: parallel mg sin θ, perpendicular mg cos θ.
Express electrostatic force using Coulomb's law: Fe = k q^2/d^2, acts horizontally right.
Set equilibrium condition: horizontal component of Fe balances gravitational component parallel to plane.
Substitute Fe = k q^2/d^2 into equilibrium equation: k q^2/d^2 cos θ = mg sin θ.
Solve for q^2/d^2: q^2/d^2 = mg sin θ / (k cos θ).
Simplify right-hand side: q^2/d^2 = mg tan θ / k.
Take square root to find q/d: q/d = sqrt(mg tan θ / k).
Final answer is q/d = sqrt(mg tan θ / k).
